snippet: China is the planet’s most populous country and second largest by land mass. Its civilization is one of the world’s oldest, and it has maintained an advanced economy for two millennia. A single-party socialist state, China has been...
lead_paragraph:
China is the planet’s most populous country and second largest by land mass. Its civilization is one of the world’s oldest, and it has maintained an advanced economy for two millennia. A single-party socialist state, China has been governed by the Communist Party since the establishment of the People’s Republic of China in 1949 under Mao Zedong, who would usher in both the Cultural Revolution and the Great Leap Forward.

China has become one of the globe’s fastest-growing post-industrial economies since reforms were put into place in 1978 by Deng Xiaoping and his supporters, and its rapid industry growth since then has led to competition with the United States and Europe. China’s expanding economic and global influence and perceived authoritarianism have contributed to its image as a formidable world power and played into both regional clashes and accusations of censorship and civil rights violations.

Keep up to date on breaking news in China and explore our extensive archive below.

snippet: An informal vote on how to select Hong Kong’s leader reflects resentment that the Beijing-oriented political-business machine is rigged against the people.
lead_paragraph: An informal vote on how to select Hong Kong’s leader reflects resentment that the Beijing-oriented political-business machine is rigged against the people.
abstract: Informal vote on how to select Hong Kong’s leader reflects resentment that the Beijing-oriented political-business machine is rigged against the people; lawyers, bankers and former senior public servants to high school students say since Hong Kong returned to Chinese sovereignty in 1997, an elite beholden to the Chinese Communist Party has increasingly dominated the economy and opportunity, as well as politics.

headline.main: Hong Kong’s Democracy Supporters Chafe at Inequality and Beijing’s Sway
headline.print_headline: Hong Kong’s Democracy Supporters Chafe at Inequality and Beijing’s Sway

byline.contributor: Alan Wong contributed reporting.
byline.original: By CHRIS BUCKLEY and MICHAEL FORSYTHE

snippet: In the most far-reaching public move so far in President Xi Jinping’s drive against corruption, the Communist Party leadership expelled a retired military commander.
lead_paragraph: In the most far-reaching public move so far in President Xi Jinping’s drive against corruption, the Communist Party leadership expelled a retired military commander.
abstract: China's Communist Party expells retired military commander Xu Caihou, and hands him over for an investigation into accusations that he took bribes in return for military promotions; he becomes most prominent Chinese military leader to be purged in decades, and the most senior official named publicly in Pres Xi Jinping's campaign to clean up the elite and impose his authority on the party, government and army.

headline.main: China’s Antigraft Push Snares an Ex-General
headline.print_headline: China’s Antigraft Push Snares an Ex-General

byline.contributor: Jonathan Ansfield contributed reporting from Beijing, and Michael Forsythe from Hong Kong.

snippet: Dozens died in what the official Chinese account described as a terrorist attack by Islamist extremists, but Uighur exile groups say was excessive police force against protesters.
lead_paragraph: Dozens died in what the official Chinese account described as a terrorist attack by Islamist extremists, but Uighur exile groups say was excessive police force against protesters.
abstract: China's official news agency reveals more details about bloody clash between Chinese security forces and ethnic Uighurs in country’s far west Xinjiang region; describes confrontation, in which dozens of people died, as a terrorist attack by Islamist extremists, but Uighur exile groups say police used excessive force on antigovernment protesters.

headline.main: After Deadly Clash, China and Uighurs Disagree on Events That Led to Violence
headline.print_headline: After Deadly Clash, China and Uighurs Disagree on Events That Led to Violence

byline.contributor: Patrick Zuo contributed reporting.

snippet: A Greek government official said that a merchant vessel had been chartered by the Chinese government for the evacuation of hundreds of its citizens, but gave no further details.
lead_paragraph: A Greek government official said that a merchant vessel had been chartered by the Chinese government for the evacuation of hundreds of its citizens, but gave no further details.
abstract: Chinese government charters merchant vessel from Greece for the evacuation of hundreds of its citizens; evacuations have been prompted by clashes between rival militias in Libya.

headline.main: Greece: Government Aids Evacuations From Libya
headline.print_headline: Greece: Government Aids Evacuations From Libya

snippet: A luxury market in skins, meat and wine endangers the rare cat.
lead_paragraph: A luxury market in skins, meat and wine endangers the rare cat.
abstract: Op-Ed article by journalist Sharon Guynup warns that threat to endangered tigers in China has evolved, with demand increasing among country's wealthy elite for elicit tiger parts that are considered a luxurious status symbol; notes deadly commerce is fueled by country's captive breeding farms, which hold more than 5,000 animals; calls on other nations to demand answers and accountability.
